messages.content: Smart Sync automatically syncs data between the mobile app and cloud storage. To use it, enable the feature under Settings → Sync, then choose a sync frequency (real‑time, every 15 minutes, or manual). You can restrict syncing to Wi‑Fi only in the Network Preference section.

Smart Sync supports files up to 2 GB. Larger files must be uploaded manually. When using real‑time sync, the feature may increase battery consumption; select the "Every 15 minutes" mode or enable "Low Power" to reduce drain.

Common issues: • Sync does not start – ensure at least 500 MB free storage and that background‑data permission is granted. • Sync stalls after network change – restart the app or toggle Smart Sync off/on. • For Wi‑Fi‑only syncing, adjust the Network Preference in Settings.

messages.content:
### FAQ – Smart Sync

**1. How do I enable Smart Sync?**
Go to **Settings → Sync** and toggle **Smart Sync** on.

**2. What sync frequency options are available?**
- Real‑time (default)
- Every 15 minutes
- Manual (run sync manually)

**3. Can I limit Smart Sync to Wi‑Fi only?**
Yes. In **Settings → Sync → Network Preference**, select **Wi‑Fi only**.

**4. What is the maximum file size Smart Sync can handle?**
Files up to **2 GB** are supported. Larger files must be uploaded manually.

**5. Why is my battery draining faster with Smart Sync enabled?**
Real‑time sync consumes more power. Choose the **Every 15 minutes** mode or enable **Low Power** in the Sync settings to reduce battery usage.

**6. Smart Sync does not start after I enable it. What should I do?**
Ensure the device has at least **500 MB** of free storage and that the **background‑data permission** is granted for the app.

**7. Sync stalls after I change from Wi‑Fi to LTE. How can I fix it?**
Restart the app or toggle **Smart Sync** off and on again. The system will re‑establish the connection.

**8. Where can I view the sync status and logs?**
Open **Settings → Sync → Sync History** to see recent sync activities and any errors.

**9. I need to sync a file larger than 2 GB. What’s the recommended approach?**
Upload the large file manually via the **Web Portal** or split it into smaller chunks before syncing.
